messages.content:
I am filling a US tax W8 form.

I don't know what to write with respect to being a resident of the UK for claiming a lower tax

 Claim of Tax Treaty Benefits (for chapter 3 purposes only) (see instructions)
9 I certify that the beneficial owner is a resident of within the meaning of the income tax
treaty between the United States and that country.
10 Special rates and conditions (if applicableâ€”see instructions): The beneficial owner is claiming the provisions of Article and paragraph
of the treaty identified on line 9 above to claim a % rate of withholding on (specify type of income):
.
Explain the additional conditions in the Article and paragraph the beneficial owner meets to be eligible for the rate of withholding:

To claim the tax treaty benefits for chapter 3 purposes, you must be a resident of the UK within the meaning of the income tax treaty between the United States and that country. This means that you must have lived in the UK for at least one year during the previous two years and have a significant presence in the UK.

In order to be eligible for the special rate of withholding on UK income, you must also meet the additional conditions in the treaty. For example, if the treaty allows for withholding on UK income at a rate of 20%, you must meet the conditions for that rate, such as having at least $5,000 in adjusted adjusted gross income (AGI) during the tax year.

Additionally, the treaty may also require you to meet other conditions, such as having a tax treaty relationship with the UK or being a covered person within the meaning of the treaty. It's important to consult with a tax professional to understand the specific requirements for each treaty and your specific situation.
This is for a prize won at a hackathon, so it's neither employment income nor does it come from trade in the US. What article / paragraph would that be?

If you won a prize at a hackathon and are eligible to claim tax treaty benefits, you may be able to do so under certain conditions. To be eligible for tax treaty benefits, you must be a resident of the UK within the meaning of the income tax treaty between the United States and that country.

To determine whether you are a resident of the UK for tax treaty purposes, you may want to consult with a tax professional. This will depend on your specific circumstances, such as whether you have lived in the UK for at least one year during the previous two years and whether you have a significant presence in the UK.

If you are a resident of the UK for tax treaty purposes and are eligible for tax treaty benefits, you may be able to claim the special rate of withholding on your prize income at a rate of up to 20%. You will also need to meet the additional conditions in the treaty, such as having at least $5,000 in AGI during the tax year and having a tax treaty relationship with the UK.

It's important to note that the specific requirements for tax treaty benefits may vary depending on your specific situation and the treaty you are applying for. It's always best to consult with a tax professional to understand the specific requirements and to ensure that you are applying in the best interests of your tax situation.
